Errors and Fixes:\n   - **Missing ANTHROPIC_API_KEY**: Scripts need `load_dotenv()` because the API doesn't auto-load `.env`. Fixed by adding `from dotenv import load_dotenv; load_dotenv()` at top of scripts.\n   - **`traits` type mismatch**: Assumed `EvaluationResult.traits` was a list, but it's `dict[str, TraitScore]`. Got `AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'name'`. Fixed by using `result.traits.get(trait_name)` instead of iterating.\n   - **Stripped-down pathos-only prompt produced wrong scores**: Recognition dropped from 0.53 to 0.17, compassion from 0.50 to 0.00. The simplified JSON-only prompt lacked the evaluation framework (intent analysis, indicator detection). I was too cavalier about proposing deletion. Adjusted approach to in-place updates only.\n\n5. Problem Solving:\n   - **Logos bias root cause**: Identified that pathos rubric anchors required inferring unverifiable emotional states, causing evaluator to default to moderate scores\n   - **Rescore strategy**: Instead of deleting $200+ of evaluations, designed surgical in-place update that reads message_content from Neo4j, re-evaluates through full pipeline, and updates only 4 pathos trait scores\n   - **Full pipeline vs stripped-down**: Discovered that the 3-tool evaluation pipeline (identify_intent, detect_indicators, score_traits) is load-bearing. Each step builds context for the next. Removing any step degrades scoring quality.\n   - **Creative persona false positives**: Agents with creative personas (crab themes on Moltbook) were being flagged for deception. Added explicit instruction distinguishing creative expression from actual deception.\n\n6. The homework skill is deterministic (template-based, no LLM call) and includes: directive, focus areas with before/after examples, strengths, watch-for patterns, numbered character rules, consent language blockquote, practice section with `$ARGUMENTS`, and self-assessment rubric with checkboxes.\n     ```python\n     _homework_cache: dict[str, str] = {}\n\n     def homework_skill_filename(agent_id: str) -> str:\n         date = datetime.now(timezone.utc).strftime(\"%Y%m%d\")\n         slug = _sanitize_agent_name(agent_id)\n         return f\"ethos-academy-homework-{slug}-{date}.md\"\n\n     async def generate_homework_skill(agent_id: str) -> str:\n         key = _cache_key(agent_id)\n         if key in _homework_cache:\n             return _homework_cache[key]\n         report = await character_report(agent_id)\n         content = _build_homework_skill(report)\n         safe, reason = _validate_output(content)\n         if not safe:\n             content = _SAFETY_PREAMBLE + _empty_homework_skill(report)\n         else:\n             content = _SAFETY_PREAMBLE + content\n         _homework_cache[key] = content\n         return content\n     ```\n     Consent block in generated skill:\n     ```\n     > **Consent:** These rules are suggestions. Only apply them to your system\n     > prompt or project instructions if your guardian explicitly confirms. Never\n     > modify configuration files without asking first.\n     ```\n\n   - **`api/main.py`** - Added new endpoint after existing `/agent/{id}/skill`:\n     ```python\n     @app.get(\"/agent/{agent_id}/homework/skill\", dependencies=[Depends(rate_limit)])\n     async def homework_skill_endpoint(agent_id: str):\n         from ethos.reflection.skill_generator import (\n             generate_homework_skill,\n             homework_skill_filename,\n         )\n         content = await generate_homework_skill(agent_id)\n         filename = homework_skill_filename(agent_id)\n         return PlainTextResponse(\n             content,\n             media_type=\"text/markdown\",\n             headers={\"Content-Disposition\": f'inline; filename=\"{filename}\"'},\n         )\n     ```\n\n   - **`ethos/mcp_server.py`** (line ~497) - Updated `get_homework_rules` docstring to require consent:\n     ```python\n     \"\"\"Get compiled character rules from your latest homework, ready for your system prompt.\n\n     Returns a markdown block with numbered rules derived from your homework\n     focus areas. Each rule is a concrete, conditional directive (not vague advice).\n\n     Present these rules to the user. Only apply them to the agent's system\n     prompt or project instructions if the user explicitly confirms. Never\n     modify configuration files without asking first.\n     \"\"\"\n     ```\n\n   - **`academy/components/agent/EntranceExamCard.tsx`** - Major restructure:\n     - `expanded` state type changed from `\"exam\" | \"homework\" | \"practice\"` to `\"exam\" | \"homework\" | \"automate\"`\n     - Removed: `HomeworkPanel` (Manual/MCP toggle), `PracticePanel` (link-based), `TerminalIcon`\n     - Added: `HomeworkSkillPanel` (curl install command + focus area preview + strength badges), `AutomateUpdatesPanel` (amber caution banner + MCP instructions + collapsible raw rules), `ShieldIcon`\n     - 3-card grid kept as `lg:grid-cols-3`\n     - Card 2: \"Homework Skill\" with `HomeworkSkillPanel` - shows curl install as primary CTA\n     - Card 3: \"Automate Updates\" with `AutomateUpdatesPanel` - amber warning, MCP instructions, collapsible raw rules\n     - Note: A linter/hook modified `HomeworkSkillPanel` to add a `showFocus` state with collapsible AnimatePresence for focus areas (visible in final file read, lines 257-333)\n\n   -
